pros: The staff at UHCL are really sweet and helpful. My managers always understood the importance of school and really help you to succeed. I loved working here at the library and learned so much while I was there. Safety was also really important to everyone and they made sure that I felt safe as a young female worker.
cons: The only downside would be that sometimes the hours were weird depending on what was going on. Once we opened back up after Covid there was an adjustment period but other than that it was excellent.

pros: Benefits, indoors in the AC, reliable computers, some good & helpful co-workers, leaving the company! Students are wonderful! Caylee and Carmen in HR are the best! Thank you so much!
cons: Not flexible with hours, can not work around your school schedule, looked down upon when asking questions, especially superiors, some employee parking has no shade and extremely hot, office politics in every office, be careful who you trust here, walking on eggshells with superiors, non-inclusive behavior toward ethnic minorities, judged and accused, made to feel inferior and not part of a team, was never good enough and undermined & undervalued all the time! Get everything in writing including absence requests and approvals via email and not verbal agreement. Be careful with HR as some of them can be hard to deal with.

review_title: Student Employee Job in Student Housing
pros: they generally work with your schedule and allow you to complete class assignments as you sit at the desk and wait to be needed
cons: as a student employee, you face some discrimination because you aren't a "real employee" despite being employed by the university system. you are ineligible for employee parking and if you work in the Department of Student Affairs like I did, you are excluded from Department bonding activities. You don't even get an employee badge and they just add building access to your student ID instead. they only let me work 4-hours max each shift so they didn't have to provide breaks. it's exhausting to work multiple shifts a day and have to be back and forth in the building and clock in and out several times a day

review_title: Pretty campus, but very low pay and even lower morale
pros: Atmosphere, wildlife on campus, easy parking, very laid back, very slow pace (which can also be a con if you need help meeting a deadline).
cons:
Certainly the low pay which causes a high turnover.  Student base is too small and therefore creates a lack of adequate revenue.  Support staff make between $10-$15 per hour.  Some have worked here 20+ years and still make a salary in the same $10-$15 range.  Unbelievable.  

Raises?  None exist.  Many people here have to work two jobs to make ends meet.  Why do they stay?  I'm not sure.  Probably for the insurance coverage and extra paid holidays.

Also, there is no room for advancement since the campus is so small.

pros: It is a beautiful campus.  There are some wonderful people among the staff members.. Some great faculty members and friends in the community.
cons: There is very little room for growth.  They are far too happy to leave the financial burden on the students and state, leaving little monies for real progress.  They are more concerned with processes and take little effort to honestly appreciate the employees and their innate gifts, all public statements to the contrary.  There is no accountability, leaving bad managers and leaders to do whatever they want, which has a perilous toll on employees.

review_title: It could get better, but it will probably get worse...
pros: Very hard to get fired, people have worked here for decades, nice management
cons: Very hard to get fired.. Those who need to get let go aren't, people have worked here for decades and are stuck in their ways, management is too nice when it comes to doing their job instead of keeping friends

review_title: Best Place to work if you are a student worker
job_title: Student Worker At Student Assistance Center in Antalya
pros:
I enjoyed each moment while I was working as a Student Technician. The best place to work as a student tech where you can concentrate on your academics as well.
Happy and fun-filled environment.
Well documented procedures.
Very helpful co-ordinators.
Vey helpful team-mates.
Boss was like a friend.
The list will go on.
cons: Landing at this job is kind of a difficult one. That too being an International student it is really really difficult. But if you get it, the best place for a student worker.

pros: Great benefits paid, beautiful place to work, mostly nice people
cons: Poor pay, not much chance for a raise, practically no way to advance your career, people are promoted by longevity and not productivity, administrators are completely out of touch with most of the secretaries who support them, and you are highly unlikely to ever be recognized or praised for the good work you do except perhaps in a yearly email

review_title: Amazing working at the Biotechnology Department
job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Houston, TX
pros:
My other TA's were amazing and always on time.
Everything needed to set-up the lab was provided and we lacked nothing.
The supervisors were very helpful and encouraging
cons:
One semester I had a CO-TA who was not that punctual and was lackadaisical towards the job.
Occasional disappearance of apparatus from the lab.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Clear Lake, TX
pros: Paid health insurance which is awesome. Opportunity to get life insurance up to 4x your annual salaray for a few dollars per month. Normally about 2 weeks paid days off for Christmas vacation.  Beautiful campus. Tuition benefits of $750 per semester for college, even it is isn't this one. Very friendly staff and supportive faculty.
cons: Not much chance for advancement. Not much chance for salary raises unless you are qualified for an upper level position.

review_title: One of the best places I've worked.
pros: Great environment. Our department was small and felt like a little family. Benefits were great. Tuition reimbursement and up to three paid hours a week for either fitness or school. The job itself was pretty easy. You get to know a lot of people at the University and in the community. There are always holiday events and activities.
cons: None really. Maybe give more responsibilities to the position if the person is doing well.

review_title: TA is good work during grad school
job_title: Teaching Assistant in Clear Lake, TX
pros: If you get the right TA position then you're not worked to death, have time to work on your own classwork, get tuition benefits (for out of state or international students), and a small stipend.  Also, you end up being "around" more, so you have additional access to professors.
cons: Be careful making sure that the hours work for you.  Better to negotiate ahead of time rather than regret it for the whole semester.
